children.text: Analytical Framework: The Rhetorical Situation and Appeals

The analytical framework for this project comes from Nicotra's "Becoming Rhetorical" textbook. Specifically, I'm analyzing "Driverless Dilemma" podcast through the lens of rhetorical appeals (ethos, pathos, logos) and the basic rhetorical situation (communicator, audience, message). Nicotra introduces these concepts in Chapter 1 ("The Basic Rhetorical Situation") and Chapter 3 ("Analyzing Textual Rhetoric").

In this clip from the "Driverless Dilemma" episode of RadioLab, hosts Jad and Robert introduce the trolley problem, which serves as a frame for the entire episode. Listeners can relate to the trolley problem and apply it to the new technology of driverless cars to understand the kind of moral decisions the vehicles will have to make on the road.
